trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_000<tab>Well met, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>, and welcome to the Drownin' Wench! Consider me place yer 'ome away from 'ome.
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_001<tab>This town's famous fer lettin' any bugger in an' fer doin' naught to stop 'em leavin', so ye'd best get used to dealin' with free spirits.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_002<tab>Most folk're still recoverin' from that thrice-damned Calamity, though, and are in sore need o' yer 'venturin' talents. Ye do yer best to put things to right, and I'll do me best to 'elp ye out when ye need it.
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_010<tab>Well, well, look what the coeurl drug in! From all I 'ear, ye've been makin' a fine name fer yerself!
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_011<tab>An' to think, when ye first wandered into the Wench, ye could barely find yer way to the privy!

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_020<tab>Ah, so yer the <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> I've been 'earin' so much about. 'Tis a pleasure indeed to finally meet ye in the flesh.
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_021<tab>The name's Baderon, an' this most 'ospitable of 'ostelries is the Drownin' Wench.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_022<tab>'Tis a place where 'venturers like yerself gather to rest up, listen to the latest gossip, an' take on any tasks what need doin'. An' in this day an' age, there ain't no shortage o' tasks what need doin'. I 'ope yer good an' ready to pitch in, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_030<tab>Well, if it ain't me ol' mate, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! I barely recognized ye, what with that 'eroic aura obfuscatin' yer mug!
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_031<tab>Now, what can this 'umble bartender do fer the champion of Eorzea, eh? A frothin' pint o' Baderon's best?
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_032<tab>Me place is always open, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>, so feel free to drop in whenever yer travels bring ye to Limsa!

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_040<tab>Now 'ere's a <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var> I never tire o' seein'. 'Ave a seat, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, and tell ol' Baderon what 'e can do for ye today.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_041<tab>...A tale from me past? Aye, I could tell you a tale or two...but not today. Come back when ye've lived as long as me─if yer still kickin' around then, that is.
TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_050<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! The rumor mill's been spinnin' full tilt, but I see yer 'ead's still attached to yer body.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_051<tab>Them Ul'dahn bastards've got some nerve pinnin' that shite-stained accusation on the bloody hero of Eorzea. Limsa might be full o' pirates and cutthroats, but Thanalan's got its fair share o' black-hearted villains, an' that's the gods' honest truth.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_052<tab>Ah, but I'd best reel in me tongue afore I get ye into more strife. The Wench is full of unfamiliar faces these days, and more'n a few of 'em make me nose twitch...

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_060<tab>The winds've carried me word o' yer fortunes, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! I hear Nanamo's back on 'er feet, an' yer name's been cleared o' wrongdoin'.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_061<tab>Nasty bit o' business, that. But now that it's over, 'ow about ye pull up a stool an' 'oist a pint with some of me regulars? They won't know what we're celebratin', but that don't matter much─these sots'll drink to damn near anythin'!

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_070<tab>Things sound a right mess out there on Gridania's border, an' if I know ye 'alf as well as I think I do, ye'll soon be back in the thick of it. Whatever 'appens, ye come back alive to tell the tale to ol' Baderon, eh?

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_080<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! Sounds like ye've been 'avin' a right proper rumble with them imperial bastards. Bit worrisome to 'ear some o' me ol' mercenary mates 'ave lent their blades to the battle...

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_090<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, good to see ye 'ale an' 'ole. Word 'as it things are a right mess in Garlemald, but the towers are gone at least, so I'll take it as a small victory.

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_100<tab>Just when we was pityin' the poor bastards over in Thavnair, those blasphemy abominations start appearin' in our own backyard. Things ain't lookin' good...

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_110<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, ever a sight fer sore eyes! When yer starship came flyin' back, this ol' mercenary was weepin' tears o' joy, an' 'e ain't ashamed to admit it!

TEXT_REGSEATHEDROWNINGWENCH_00158_BADERON_000_111<tab>Now, I ain't sure me bar's got anythin' worthy o' the savior of the star. But what we lack in quality, we can always make up fer in quantity, ain't that right!?
